page.title: 03MAPPERLEY HOSPITAL
page.content: Mapperley Hospital was established in 1880.When it opened,people were very hostile towards the mentally ill.Such hospitals were built in the suburbs of towns.To control the patients,several methods were used such as air spectacles,straight jackets and hydrotherapy.Today,care for mentally ill patients is community based. Therapy includes discussions about personal problems and drugs used.Over 50% of Mapperley's patients are on a day care programme,where they come in the day and sleep in their own homes. The size of the hospital has changed dramatically over the last century. Originally designed for 1000 patients, today it accommodates 303.In the future,Mapperley Hospital is to be closed,and care for mentally unstable people will be even more community based. Clair Palmer(11)
